Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Christophe R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are confortable, clean, calm (we were located at the back of the building). Personnel is pleasant. Breakfast is very good and copious. Transportation rapidly accessible > with the metro, centre city is at 20min (10' by walking + 10' by metro).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel away from City Centre”
Reviews.Author: gmun
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights at the end of January. It is a very nice hotel with small but comfortable rooms. It is quite far from the city centre. We used the Metro which was great but do not use the L7 line (El Puxtet station) as they are doing construction and it takes much longer to get to the city. We found the L3 (Lesseps Station) which is about a 10 min walk from the hotel but the service is much more frequent and you do not have to change trains. Get a 10 use metro card for 10 euro. It is much cheaper than paying each time. The TV is all in Spanish but we were able to change it to English on the remote using the subtitle button. It changes the voices to the original English but only on American shows. The bathroom was very small and we found that the hot water in the shower would go very cold during high usage times. There is a safe in the room to lock up valuables but you must leave a 20 Euro deposit at reception. We tried the breakfast once and it is not worth the price at all, not enough selection and it had been sitting for a long time. There is not a lot of choices for dining in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but away from the centre!”
Reviews.Author: Pandybahlu
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and spacious. There was also wifi available. The staff was great. The rooms are a bit outdated though. But overall it was priced well for its value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, a little dated, directions in this review.”
Reviews.Author: RichMax_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last week. A bit difficult to find so please see directions at the end of this review. We enjoyed our stay but feel it worth being frank. This hotel is a bit dated, average, but very clean. Think of UK Travel Lodge and you will be close. Staff are all lovely and speak pretty good english, very polite and helpful. The room on 4th floor was smaller than we expected, with en suite also challenged for space. The shower had a knack of changing temperature half way through and make sure you have shower gel as those left for you in the bathroom are only about 5ml samples. Bed and towels changed and room cleaned daily to a high standard. The bed was not comfortable but that might just be us. Sound proofing would be great as you can hear most things late at night from other rooms and flats opposite. This only disturbed us on one night so its probably not a big problem. Breakfast, if you book it at reception will set you back 10 euros each plus tax. Good buffet and pleasant surroundings just off reception. The hot food choice of scrambled eggs, bacon, spicy sausage soon cooled when on the plate. The rest of the buffet was very good. If you prefer there are other places local for breakfast. DIRECTIONS to hotel from airport. Journey time from airport to hotel is approx 1 hour. Please note, there are different train companies and the train ticket you buy at the airport station will not be valid on the metro. You can easily get multi company tickets when you get into the city and onto the metro, its not hard at all, just confusing at first. Use the machines at metro stations to get tickets that last 10 or more journeys and all the train companies, very easy. Assuming you arrive at Barcelona International airport, take the train into Barcelona city and get out at 4th stop which is Passieg de Gracia station. Get onto the metro for the L3 line (light green signs). You will have to go one stop to Catalunya station to change onto the L7 line (brown signs) for the hotel going in direction of Av.Tibidabo. Its just 5 stops to El Putxet (pronounced Putchet). Come up onto the street and go down hill about 50 yards. Take first left up a short slope and then turn right. The hotel is about 100 yards down the road on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Great place !”
Reviews.Author: Micki L
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending 8 days in Barcelona at this neat hotel ! Really enjoyed it . It is located in a residential area only a 1-2 minute walk to the Metro station and convenience stores. . The rooms are basic, but roomy and very clean. ( the rooms are cleaned daily). I can't say enough about the wonderful front desk staff ! They are very friendly, accommodating, helpful and informative . They spent a lot of time helping guests plan their day, best routes to take, etc. I didn't think too highly of the buffet offered for 10 Euros in the dining room, but everyone else seemed to enjoy it. It was nice to be able to use the computer for free in the reception area, or just relax there with a book , if you didn't want to return to your room just yet. I was travelling by myself, so made sure I was back in the area near the hotel before dark. Always felt safe when I was. Did a couple of city bus tours, which I enjoyed . After that, I travelled around the city by Metro ( with the help of the ever-friendly front desk staff at the hotel) . If you have trouble negotiating stairs, watch out. There are endless stairs at the Metro stations, and not all stations have escalators or elevators. But, loved this hotel and would have no hesitation recommending it to others. Would stay there again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Staff very helpful, safe area and hotel close to metro”
Reviews.Author: ECamilleri
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very helpful (except the waitress). The only little problem we had was the fact that we had to change room on the second day since the wireless connection was poor in our first room, but they did their best to help us out. Although the hotel is not in the middle of the Ramblas, the closest subway is just 1minute away making every part of Barcelona reachable within minutes. Even when we stood out a bit later the taxi was not as expensive as i expected ( only around 10 euros form ramblas, and about 14 euros from Opiummar). Just keep in mind that hotels of the same type but located more centrally would cost much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Vera87
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel for a week in August; chose it because it was relatively cheap and close to the subway (which indeed it was, just round the corner, 7-10 minutes to the city center). Before I arrived, I was in a long sweet correspondence with the front desk staff, because my credit card didn't work out for the pre-paid reservation, and they were helping me out to make a bank transfer. When I came, they turned out to be just as friendly in person, and my check-in was smooth and fast, and with a nice upgrade as well, which made me happy right from the first day there. I had an apartment on the top floor, with no windows except for a small one in the roof. The bed was great; although the pillows a bit too small. I also had a living room with a sofa, a TV with a decent number of channels (the TV picture froze sometimes, but you just have to turn it off and on again; and anyway I didn't come to Barcelona to watch TV). The kitchen was fine; I didn't have the utensils, but I guess they can be given upon request; I just didn't need it really, because I only made some tea in the evenings and nothing more. The bathroom was small, but very clean, with fresh towels every day and all the regular shampoo/soap stuff. The whole apartment was very clean as well; maybe a tiny bit weary, and very simple and basic, but still in a perfect condition, with no dust or mold anywhere. I didn't use the breakfast there; but I did use the computer in the lobby, which was available free of charge - a nice touch! The lobby itself was also sparkling clean and pleasant to stay in, with some nice music playing. The subway trip to the city center is not very bothering; it takes no more than 10 minutes and the trains are half empty. It's probably not for those people who want to go out of the hotel and find themselves in the middle of La Rambla, but it was my 3rd time in Barcelona and I decided to go for a quiet place rather then the overcrowded center. In the late evenings I was a bit nervous returning by subway, as I was a single female traveling, but it seems that there are always some people coming off at the Putxet station, so I wasn't completely alone. On the morning of my departure, I had a taxi at about 4 am, and of course I was late for it, but when I flew down the stairs the very nice gentlemen at the reception was already holding out my invoice, so I literally didn't even have to stop to check-out, and I was immensely grateful for this care. To sum up: it's a friendly, clean, inexpensive, if somewhat basic, little place, perfect to explore Barcelona when you are not eager to be in the center of touristic life. Don't expect luxuries, and you will get a very decent room, good sleep and a warm welcome. The staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars no more”
Reviews.Author: PPPierpaolo
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is relatively far from the city center, even if in zone 1 of Metro, but fortunately is really close to a RER station, so in 8 minutes I was able to be in Placa Cataluna. Rooms was very clean and modern, recently restruptured. Bathroom well done. I suggest this hotel for the good quality-price

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Dont take a car!”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTraveller02
Reviews.Content: Good hotel nice rooms, especially terrace rooms. Parking very difficult in the area as you would expect. Hotel is in a back street off a side street and is difficult to find by car. Hotel garage has only 3 spaces with a very steep spiral ramp. If the other spaces were full you wouldnt be able to turn at the bottom and would have to reverse out. Even drving out facing the right way was a challenge and the car ( which did not have a long wheelbase) grounded on the pavement.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, well kept hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: MattB88
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this quiet backstreet hotel for four days in mid June, and even though we knew the hotel wasn't in the centre of Barcelona we were surprised with the lack of bars and restaurants near to the hotel*, this wasn't really a problem though as El Putxet metro station is less the 5 minutes walk away. The hotel was clean and well kept throughout and all the staff were friendly and polite. The room was on the front of the hotel so didn't have a view but was spacious and fairly modern and was promptly cleaned and provided with fresh towels and linen on a daily basis. The overpriced mini bar wasn't working in our room but was quickly repaired when we mentioned this to the receptionist, so came in handy for storing our own drinks in! (There is a small shop on the same street as the hotel and a small supermarket just past the El Putxet station so no need to use the mini bar). The room also came with a safe which you could request the key for at reception in return for a 20 euro deposit. We had the buffet breakfast on the first morning which cost 10.80 Euros and offered a good range of fresh hot and cold food and drink. I would certainly recommend this hotel for those people looking for a pleasant stay in one of Barcelona’s quieter locations. *We did find one restaurant which is definiately worth a visit. It's an italian restaurant called Da Raimondo, Carrer del Putget, 36 (about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a quiet place!”
Reviews.Author: rcorreia
Reviews.Content: 1 minute away from the nearest subway station! 5 subway stations away from Barcelona center (+/- 15minutes). Quiet place, very clean, very nice staff. Good breakfast. One computer with internet at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, friendly staff in a quiet/safe part of Barcelona - a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Bucky1600
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, especially for the price! Located in a quiet, upscale district of Barcelona with easy access to Metro/local trains (efficient 10-15min transport to the city center) and walking distance to amazing Parc del Turo del Putxet and Parc Guell. While Gaudi's Parc Guell is a must see, the adjacent Parc del Turo provides quiet (i.e. nearly tourist free) shaded views of the city. Pick up a few items at one of the nearby market and you have the makings of an ideal picnic! The hotel staff was friendly and welcoming, one of the few places during our tour of Spain where they immediately offered a map and inquired if we needed any directions/recommendations. The jet tubs in every room were very much appreciated after a day of walking the city! Positives: friendly, very helpful staff; rooms quiet, clean, well updated; great location in quiet/safe neighborhood; proximity to transport/parks; easy wi-fi access; jet-tubs in each room; a great value! Negatives: smaller rooms/bathrooms; our broken mini-bar was never repaired during our 5-night stay (would have been nice to have access to cool beverages) We would definitely stay hear again on our next visit to Barcelona. If you don't mind a 10-15min ride into the city center it is worth certainly worth it for the quality of this hotel/neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and close to city delights via 10 min metro ride!”
Reviews.Author: KJbeckett
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 9 month old daughter. Room 501 has a lovely balcony/terrace with table and chairs! The room was big enough to fit in the travel cot provided by the hotel comfortably with space to still move around..it has to be said the cot we were provided had a rip in the side of it which we plugged with a shirt-im sure a replacement cot could have been provided if we were concerned that our daughter might get her head caught in the unplugged hole. air con was great due to the heat although if your a light sleeper you may find yourself being woken up by it during the night unless you fully switch it off. There are a few local shops near the hotel if you want fresh bread/pastries, fruit etc although I would say walk a little further to find other bakeries as the one closer to hotel isn't all that good! Metro is right around corner which is great. Regarding room and bathroom..nothing to complain about unless you are taller than 5'10 due to the bath being a tad small and shower quite low. Also i would say again if your a light sleeper the hotel at the time we stayed was a tad noisy-could hear lift chime from our room, people talking and feet moving but it quietened down at around 10pm. Also no tea/coffee/kettle so if travelling with babies this may be a problem however I made up my daughters milk using milk powder and bottled water which was fine! We didn't have breakfast as it was cheaper to go to the famous food Market la boquirea and have fresh fruit salad, smoothies and croissants for 1.50€ or less!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ivazd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely superb! I loved everything about it - the staff was friendly, the breakfast was awesome and the room was nice and clean. I cannot think of anything bad when thinking about my experience @ this hotel. I sure would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone: families, business people, couples - absolutely anyone! :)

Reviews.Title: “Kelpo hotelli, vaikka vähän sivummalla keskustasta”
Reviews.Author: Gemgirl84
Reviews.Content: Sijainti rauhallisella asuinalueella mielenkiintoisimman keskustan ulkopuolella, mutta kuitenkin julkisen liikenteen, esim. metroverkoston avulla keskustankin nähtävyyksien ulottuvilla. Hyvä hinta-laatusuhde, runsas aamiainen (lämpiminä munia, pekonia ja pikkumakkaroita, lisäksi sämpylöitä, paahtoleipää, juustoja, kinkkua ja leikkeleitä, hedelmäpaloja, erilaisia jugurtteja, muroja, hyvää kahvia kahvikoneesta ja makeita kahvileipävaihtoehtoja). Huone oli siisti ja siivous huolellista. Ilmainen nettikone oli käytettävissä hotellin aulassa, respassa palvelu oli ystävällistä vaikkakaan ei välttämättä täysin kielitaitoista (englanniksi). Miinuspuolena huoneen ilmastointi ei tuntunut toimivan kuin on-off -periaatteella, eli puhalsi täysillä kylmää tai sitten ilmanvaihto ei toiminut ollenkaan (peilit jäivät pitkäksi aikaa huuruun kylvyssä/suihkussa käynnin jälkeen).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised - ignore Street View photos!”
Reviews.Author: MoreCheeseGrommit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights (booked directly) just before Christmas and were pleasantly surprised by the standard especially given the rate we'd paid (<EUR60 b&b pn). It's shown as a 3 star but is probably close to 4. The room was a little on the small side, but clean and well finished. The free wifi worked well. Breakfast was good (if not as cheap as going to a cafe of course) - unlimited hot and cold buffet. The friendly staff all spoke good English. The hotel is located in a residential area but it's easy (and cheap) to get around the city on public transport. I did look at the Google street view photos before booking and they looked a bit grim (perhaps because of the light/angles etc) but actually the street was fine & felt perfectly safe at night. We've stayed in Barcelona a few times and this hotel has been by far the best value for money. Tip: be sure to check out the Restaurante Hidalgo (just by El Putxet station) - friendly staff, nice tapas and plenty of locals in when we went (usually a good sign!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, friendy stuff”
Reviews.Author: alex_povereny
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Mitre Barcelona. Friendly stuff, rooms are small but very clean and the bathroom after renovation. 10 minutes walk from metro station that will take you directly to the city center. Not a tourist area but still recommended since the prices are reasonable and the hotel is not far from park Guel.

Reviews.Title: “Still close. Nice terrace.”
Reviews.Author: Lila2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a newer area of Barcelona and it is walking distance from the park Guell of Gaudi. It's a 3 minutes walk from the ferrocarril station which takes you in cenetr Barcelona in 10 mintes maximum. Great terrace where you can drink your very affordable, yet great, bottle of wine when you come back after a full day of intense visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location is Alright.”
Reviews.Author: TJS525
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly. Good breakfast in the morning. The location is ok. It's within walking distance to a couple subway stops that can get you to anywhere in the city. There is a store about 20 meters down the street that sells snacks and beverages. Not a lot to do in the area in which the hotel is in. One problem we did find was that the subway stops running early considering most people don't go out until later in the night. This became a problem because we would have to return to the hotel earlier than we wanted because we relied on the subway to get to the restaurants and bars. The room was nice and had a mini-fridge. Overall, we were pleased with the price we paid and the quality we received.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: greeny1012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April whilst four of us across two rooms celebrated a birthday. None of us could complain about the hotel, although it was little warm in the evenings. The quiet location was lovely, especially as it was conviently located close to the metro (Palau Reial). More foten than not we grabbed breakfast from outside the metro station and there was a corner shop just down from the main entrance with very cheap food. Hotel rooms were lovely so no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: kljandrews87
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was good value - maybe because of the slightly less central location - but you could still get to where you wanted to go as there was a metro stop very close by. The hotel staff were approachable. The room suffered with a bad case of ants but the cleaner sorted that out for us without complaint. Had a good working TV. Breakfasts - beware! They are pricey and aren't included but tasted good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, we booked a return stay”
Reviews.Author: Ferson
Reviews.Content: We had a terrace room on the fifth floor, table and two chairs we had drinks there every night. Rooftops but also the hillsides are inview with the chapel and amusement park lit at night. Room was small but quiet, clean and comfortable although bath was a little short on counter space. Mini bar in a wood cabinet ran very hot limiting the cooling in the minibar. Be sure to ask for the optional pillows at no charge. Free access to a computer with internet in the lobby. Staff was very helpful and knowledgable. Pass up the breakfast, there are other alternatives around the corner at much more reasonable prices. We found the 17 bus the easiest way to get down to Plaza Catalonia, but the Metro works also.

Reviews.Title: “Well not the best tired poor service”
Reviews.Author: MCENZ
Reviews.Content: Not the best good location close to my work shame. Be careful of the spa baths run with hot water first not clean. Don't have any of the last four rooms on the top floor balcony etc might seem like a good idea but the boilers are in the roof space overhead so take some ear plugs if you want to sleep in those rooms. Also take an Iron and an Ironing board and find somewhere else to eat breakfast I didn't even bother and it was free. Be careful how you approach the staff they like to argue with you and cause unnecessary fuss so best not to bother them. If you are there for any lenght of time take some entertainment only english TV is CNN and BBC news so pretty newsed out after an hour or learn German you are ok with German 5 channels of course! Other than that it was great everything you could ask for except rooms need a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Irish_cailinCo_Clare
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in Barcleona and we stayed in the Mitre Hotel. It was a great location - only 5 metro stops from Catalunya (city centre) and the hotel was only two mins from the metro station. To find the hotel from the metro station take the balmes exit and then take the first left, the first right and the hotel will be on your right. Our room was quite basic but was clean and was plenty roomy for the two of us. The double bed was a proper double bed and not two beds pushed together. I had chanced my arm and requested a balcony and to my surprise they were wiling to give us a double room with a balcony but it would have taken an hour for the people in the room to check out and we were wrecked so we took a double room with no balcony. The man on reception, Ricardo, was very helpful and patient and helped us organise our sightseeing. There was another guy there on our last night though who was a bit standoffish and not very helpful at all-didnt catch his name. We went on the bus turistic and I'd really recommend it as a great way of seeing Barcelona in a day or two! The red stop is around 10-15 min walk from the hotel up at the top of the hill by the roundabout. A day pass was E20 and a 2 day pass was E26. Had breakfast there one morning - E10 each and it was OK. Filled the gap! We had a safe in our room which we put a E20 deposit down on and got it back when we checked out. Our room was cleaned everyday. There was no noise from the surrounding area at night as its a quiet area. Walls were perhaps a bit thin between the rooms and the corridor but not excessively so. Bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. The room also came with air conditioning at no extra cost. To get home after a night out we took taxis and they cost between 12 and 14 euros which is great! We generally ate in the city centre as we didnt find many places to eat in the area but since it was so close that didnt matter! Plus we found there was more of an atmosphere in the city. A few must sees in Barcelona in general: Sagrada Familia (even though we didnt bother going into it), La Ramblas, the cable car to Barceloneta Beach, Portaventura (not technically in Barcelona but only an hours train journey away-make sure you get the priority passes when going in!!trust me-they're worth it!!), The Hard Rock Cafe, The Sunset Dance Club, Nou Camp, Park Guell, The Magic Fountain, Park de la Ciutadella. Overall I would definitly recommend the mitre hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Basic quite hotel”
Reviews.Author: lajoa
Reviews.Content: Didn't book this hotel. Was sent to Eurostars Mitre from another hotel (Gran Ducat) that overbooked and made a deal to send us here instead. I was upset that I paid city center price to then be sent to Mitre as it is about 4 train (metro) stops from city center and for the same price we get this secluded hotel. Pros: Hotel was in a quite residential area, strong air conditioner, very helpful front-desk staff, matrimonial bed is actually a real double-bed instead of 2 twins pushed together, very clean room, good quality towels. Cons: Cable worked once my husband spent a few minutes messing with the back of the TV, very small bathroom, tiny elevator, away from city center, no real restaurants or shops around there, not near the tour bus route. I really cannot fault the hotel even with the cons I listed above. Maybe I'm just more upset because I know had I booked Mitre directly it would have been cheaper than falling for the overbooking scam Gran Ducat had going on. If you do not mind staying a bit away from city center and want a quite place away from the chaos then this hotel is the place to stay. The metro stop Puxtet was just a few short steps from the hotel so not much of a hassle and train goes directly without transfer to city center. Again, many thanks to the front desk staff for being so helpful, taking lots of time to explain the metro and recommending sightseeing options. Because the hotel is nowhere near other eating places we paid the 10 Euros per person for the breakfast and it was worth it. - Joana New Yorker living in Germany

Reviews.Title: “A good, clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: hill_dawn
Reviews.Content: This is a good, clean, quiet hotel for those travellers who would rather spend their cash on seeing Barcelona rather than on an overpriced hotel slap bang in the city centre. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from one train station and about 10 minutes to another in the other direction, so getting to see all of the sights is not a problem. The staff were pleasant and helpful and the rooms were clean, well presented and had everything you would expect other than tea/coffee making facilities. Those of you who are light sleepers may wish to take a sleep mask with you, as the curtains certainly do not block out that lovely Spanish sun first thing in the morning! The little supermarket just across the road provides you with the essentials for breakfast and packed lunches. All in all a fairly good value hotel that provides you with a good base from which you can get to see all that Barcelona has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “You could do a lot worse...”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Ruth_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a good location, even if it is a little difficult to find 1st time round! The hotel isn't in the hustle and bustle but this guarantees a good nights sleep, however it is only a couple of mins walk from the tube stop which goes directly to/from Catalunya square at the start of the Rambles and from where the entire city is accessable. The tubes were very impressive, frequent, quick and clean. Location wise we always felt safe and the supermarket over the road from the hotel is handy. Although we didn't deal with them much more than the usual check in & out the receptionists were friendly, helpful and spoke good English. The room is clean and a reasonable size, as is the bathroom and the jacuzzi bath was very welcome at the end of a busy day exploring. To sum up - This hotel wont rock your world but is good value for money and a great base to explore the city. For those that do book - From El Putext Station take the Balmes exit, carry on to the end of the road where you take a left, and then the next left again (by Pizza Hut) The hotel is a little way up on the left. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and location”
Reviews.Author: Welsh-Girl2007
Reviews.Content: We arrived late evening on the 25th june by taxi which costs around 35 euros! From the outside the hotel doesnt look the best but once you're in the hotel, its not actually that bad. Theres a 24 hour reception, so checking in was no problem and the staff was very friendly. We asked for a double bed but we actually got two twin beds pushed together (i'm not sure if thats a European thing???). The room was a reasonable size for two people. We had a bath jacuzzi which was nice and the bathroom was also a reasonable size! The room itself was very clean as it was cleaned on a daily basis. The metro station was just 5 minute walk away and it took about 10 minutes to reach the centre of Barcelona (Catalunya). We stayed for four days and bought a T-10 metro ticket which allowed you to travel upto 10 journeys and only cost 6.50 euros (ideal). Barcelona itself was great, it has everything you want in city, we would definiatley go back again and would also stay in the same hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good position, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: uni-k
Reviews.Content: .I've booked a triple room for me and my two friends at the end of august. we liked the area as it was really safe, the hotel was clean, the room quite big considering it was a triple room. I loved the so called jacuzzi, it was nice after 10 hours of wondering around Barcelona. the hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. The metro station is 3 minutes walk and within 10 min you get to plaza catalunya. That is the perfect place to start exploring. Gaudi’s park is a few bus stops from the hotel and it is fantastic. Barcelona it’s self is just fantastic, so many sites to see, one week was barely enough. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It’s clean, spacious and close to centre, in a quiet area, without the hassle of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for those who already know and love Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Poussis
Reviews.Content: A quiet, comfortable hotel in Puxtet/St Gervasi - one of the nicest areas away from the city centre. Photograph does not do the hotel justice, as outside of building is bland. Room was comfortable and very clean. If you can, ask for a room with a terrace on the top floor - the terrace was big and had a romantic view over rooftops to Tibidabo Mountain - there's a church or something on the summit which is illuminated at night. The terrace rooms are non-smoking, but you can smoke on the terrace if you want. Bathrooms had a jacuzzi-bath which added a touch of luxury. The area is perfect if you already know Barcelona and want to stay in a part of the city less frequented by tourists. It is quite high up, so feels fresher in summer, but has all the bars/cafes/restaurants/markets you could wish for. Metro will take you to centre in 10 minutes, and there are loads of buses going everywhere. We only made it to breakfast once, but it was pretty good if you're hungry - a huge help-yourself affair. Staff were polite and helpful, though not particularly chatty (we were there for 2 weeks and never really struck up a conversation with anyone). In general, ideal if you already know your way around Barcelona and want to explore it in more depth.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Fabulousbigapple
Reviews.Content: The Mitre is in a nice location, not too far from the centre but close enough to everything, It is a quiet area no noise problems from the in hotel or area at all and the hotel and rooms are very clean and good for a 3 star (even has a whirlpool bath which we loved after a tiring day sight seeing) Noticed when in the centre the noise was very loud at times so it was great knowing i would have no problem sleeping of a night at the Mitre. There are few small shops nearby and also some cafes& restaurants. It is very much an area with local people (all seemed to be friendly) and i definatly felt safe here. The hotel is only a 2 minute walk from a metro station El Putxet which will take you on a direct line into the centre which only takes about 8-10mins. They come every 10mins also and the last metro from place catalunya back to the hotel is about 11.30pm. TIP: if you have travelers cheques the hotel or surrounding areas do not exchange them, we wasted about an hour going into what we now know were only savers banks nearby trying to get them changed . In the end we ended up having to go place catalunya to get them changed but later on that day we noticed a Barclays bank about 10mins walk away from the hotel so you could prob get them changed there. Also there is a bus stop at the top of the road 10-15min walk, we only found this out the day before we left, so if you need buses they are there and also there is the RED bus stop there this is for if you get the tourist bus that takes you to sights which you can hop on and off about (18euro a day) you can get off at the top them walk down to the hotel saves having to get off at place catalunya and paying the 1 euro.20 from place catalunya to El Putxet. Also i had no problems with pickpockets, i was very worried about this before i went but i think its just about being sensible, have a zip on your bags, keep it in front of you and dont open you bag/purse in a pubic place where lots of people can see ( weeven but ribbon through the zip and then around the bag stap so there was no way a pick pocket could just unzip it without having to undo the ribbon 1st) All in all very impressed and i would definatly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: lee99Mcr
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break and found Hotel Mitre to be excellent. Rooms were very nice indeed and the staff were very nice also. Hotel is located not too far from the centre, although to walk there would be pushing it. Metro station (El Putxet) is very near by (2mins walk) which allows quick and cheap access ( 1.20 euro one way) to the centre (La Ramblas etc) Transport links we found were unbelievable, always on time and very cheap, fantastic. We had breakfast twice (buffet style,10 euros p.p) which we found good although limited hot food) We would recommend Hotel Mitre without question and would definitely return. Final thought, i read some reviews here that it's a 1* star hotel - can't see that at all because it says 3* star on the sign on the wall outside and by our experiance it is a 3* star hotel no question.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value. Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: DazzaPFC
Reviews.Content: A nice modern hotel in a handy location for the Metro. Service was good, with helpful staff on reception. Our room was a fair size, was cleaned daily (fresh towels etc) and the real treat at the end of a long day was the hydro-bath. A well-stocked mini-bar :-) We'd fully recommend this hotel as a base. The metro is 100m away, and a one-way trip to Plaza Catalunya (Las Ramblas) cost only 1.15 euros and took 5 mins. If you don't mind walking, you could easily visit many sights. We visited Parc Guell, Sagrada Familia, ending-up at the beach, and along the way discovered the bull ring, the Catalunyan Parliament, Parc De La Ciutadella and Zoo. Took best part of a day but a great way to see things and sample the 'real' Barcelona along the way. In all a very enjoyable stay and a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled By the 1 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am one of those people with champagne taste and beer money. Although my husband and I travel on a tight budget, I will not sacrifice CLEANLINESS or comfort. I don’t know why this hotel was classed with one star The jets in the tub didn’t work and the carpet in the hallway was a bit worn. But I would class this hotel by at least three stars. Our room was cleaned everyday. We got good value for our money. I would return to this hotel, no question. The hotel is not in the center of things, it’s very quite. The subway is about 200m away. There are restaurants and bars in the area. The staff was great, very helpful They suggested that we have lunch at La Taula, three blocks away…This place is amazing. 5 stars easy. The prices were the same as what we paid for 2 star dinners in the center of things. We ate there twice; IT IS A MUST FOR COUPLES.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: vaquero viajero
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel with friendly staff and comfortable clean rooms. There is a bar accross from train station with great reasonably priced tapas. You have easy access to the city center and it was great to return to the calm of the hotel at night for a quite sleep. Currently trip advisor has it listed as a 1 star hotel but this is clearly wrong. The hotel posts 3 stars and it is one of the better 3 star hotels I have stayed in in Spain. We are coming back.
